section.title: Audience
section.para: This guide is intended for resource administrators and target system integration teams.

section.title: Confidentiality
section.para: The material contained in this documentation represents proprietary, confidential information pertaining to Oracle products and methods.

The audience agrees that the information in this documentation shall not be disclosed outside of Oracle, and shall not be duplicated, used, or disclosed for any purpose other than to evaluate this procedure.

section.title: Typographical Conventions
section.para: The following typographical conventions are used in this document

row.entry: Boldface type indicates graphical user interface elements associated with an action, or terms defined in text or the glossary. Examples include window/page titles, keywords, and interactive elements such as menus, buttons, etc.
Italic type indicates book titles, emphasis, or placeholder variables for which you supply particular values.
Monospace type indicates commands within a paragraph, URLs, code in examples, text that appears on the screen, or text that you enter.
A link to another section of the document or to an external document or website.
For information about installing and using Oracle Identity and Access Management, visit the following Oracle Help Center page Oracle Identity Management 12.2.1.3.0.
For information about Oracle Linux 7 documentation, visit the following Oracle Help Center page Oracle Linux 7.
